title: Authorizes the Brentwood Church of God in Christ, Inc. to file an application for a real property tax exemption with the assessor of the town of Islip
summary: Authorizes the Brentwood Church of God in Christ, Inc. to file an application for a real property tax exemption with the assessor of the town of Islip.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2632

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 27, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. JOHNSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Government

       AN ACT to authorize the Brentwood Church of God in Christ, Inc.  to file
         an application for a real property tax exemption

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. (a) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the asses-
    2  sor of the town of Islip is hereby authorized to accept from the  Brent-
    3  wood Church of God in Christ, Inc.  an application for an exemption from
    4  real  property  taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the real property tax
    5  law for the 2002-2003 and 2003-2004 assessment rolls, as to which  March
    6  1,  2002  was the taxable status date, with respect to the real property
    7  taxes for the 2002-2003 and 2003-2004 assessment rolls for  the  parcels
    8  owned  by  such  church  located  in  the town of Islip at 72 Eisenhower
    9  Avenue, Brentwood, otherwise known as: district 500, section 113,  block
   10  2, lot 46.
   11    (b)  If accepted, such application shall be reviewed as if it had been
   12  received on or before the  taxable  status  date  established  for  such
   13  rolls.
   14    If  satisfied  that  such  church  would otherwise be entitled to such
   15  exemption if the church had filed an application for  exemption  by  the
   16  appropriate taxable status date, the assessor of the town of Islip, upon
   17  approval  by  the  town board of such town, may grant exemption from all
   18  taxation based on the 2002-2003 and 2003-2004 assessment rolls and owing
   19  by such church on the effective date  of  this  act  and  cancel  taxes,
   20  fines,  penalties  and  interest  remaining unpaid, and make appropriate
   21  corrections to the subject rolls.  If such exemption is granted and such
   22  church shall have paid any tax with respect to  the  subject  roll,  the
   23  applicable  department  of  the  town of Islip, upon the approval of the
   24  town board of such town, may in its  sole  discretion  provide  for  the
   25  refund  of those taxes paid and cancel taxes, fines, penalties or inter-
   26  est remaining unpaid.
   27    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07074-01-1
